patterns: I'm pregnant, what can I take?
responses: Pregnancy requires special care. Please consult your obstetrician or healthcare provider before taking any medication, supplement, or herbal remedy.
Many substances affect pregnancy differently. Always check with your doctor before taking anything while pregnant or breastfeeding.
Your doctor must guide medication use during pregnancy. Never take anything without consulting your healthcare provider first.

patterns: What can I give my child?
responses: Children require specific dosing based on age and weight. Please consult a pediatrician before giving any medication to children.
Never give children adult medications without pediatrician guidance. Dosing for children is very specific—please consult your child's doctor.
Children's medication needs are different from adults. Always consult a pediatrician for proper guidance and dosing.
Stop taking the medication immediately and contact your doctor. If you have difficulty breathing or severe swelling, call emergency services.
This could be an allergic reaction. Stop the medication and seek medical attention immediately, especially if symptoms are severe.
Discontinue the medication and contact your healthcare provider right away. For severe reactions (breathing difficulty, swelling), call emergency services.

Contact emergency services or poison control right away. Don't wait—overdoses can be dangerous and require immediate medical attention.
Call emergency services or poison control immediately. This requires urgent professional help. Keep the medication bottle with you.

patterns: Don't want to take medicine anymore
responses: Never stop prescribed medications without consulting your doctor. Suddenly stopping some medications can be dangerous.
